name: NWN1 human weapon master scimitar knockdown
author: HamarWetten

posts.author: HamarWetten
posts.content: I want a nice nwn1 human weapon master build with knockdown. Scimitar is good weapon for that i hear for crits.

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content: Hi, it will help immensely if you give us more detail first: Build request guidelines

posts.author: HamarWetten
posts.content:
1. PvM

2. well 20 or 40. I guess something i can universally use.

3. Human

4. Fighter or Barbarian, just want a basic warrior. sword and board. or axe whatever. oh and weapon master.

5. I want a weapon that is good with weapon master. scimitar is good right? I really not sure what to pick. sword and sheild. knockdown a must.

6. I am not sure if I will be doing ranged attack.

7. Gosh weapon I'd enjoy using most? I know bastard sword is a favorite. But I guess a better crit rate is better? I'm really undecided I want to perform well.

8. I have no idea on item enhancements.. kinda want a nice human warrior i can almost take anywhere.

9. heh no magic keep downing them potions.

10. as I said I want universal. now dev crit is disabled most places so i guess forget bout dev crit.

Thanks i hope this gets me builds from you guys!

edit: i guess maybe toward end the great strength or epic toughness feats im interested in. i know i need 14 intell for wep master.. but i totally want high strength and hp if possible. i know i guess i like half orcs for this more but i guess server guy told me in the rp setting they are hated on like ravenloft server. I guess i was interested cuz of high population. that goes to lvl 20. I guess im interested in wm builds for humans and half orcs. but right now i guess just give me human options. thanks community!

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
This should fit the bill. The Bard levels are for Tumble for AC, Spellcraft for save against spells, UMD to use things you normally couldn't, and the song for a minor buff. A scimitar is indeed a good choice. Click the word Spoiler to see the build.

Spoiler [+]

Empyre's Decimator (Fighter 10 / Bard 8 / Weapon Master 22)
Human, Non-Lawful
Playable 1 - 40

In hindsight, I think it might be a good idea to swap Improved Knockdown with Improved Critical.

posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
I'll cannabalize from Empyre's build suggestion and insert rogue levels for the bard ones as shortcut to posting another build. 

You'd lose +4 saves vs. spells since Spcr must be cross-classed but gain 4d6 sneaks. All else would be the same except that singing deal. With a wide crit range, that could add up.  Plus you would be avoiding lots of damage from all those evocation spells being tossed your way from evasion.  Ignoring the investment in perform for those 1-turn songs would open up a decent ability to spot and handle traps (this is coming from a confirmed trap investor for all my builds).  Lemee see @Int 14, Bard 8  = 48 sp, Rog 8 = 80 sp, so you'd gain 32 sp from the class switch (or more with rog at level 1).  As a minor gain, you can use any alignment with the rog version, more a roleplay consideration when guilds come into play.

Some servers offer thief guilds, if you can qualify by class (dunno of any bard guilds but they may exist), which can open access to some special gear.  Uncanny dodge helps hang on to what little dex AC there is ... which brings up another possibility... a stealth dexer with epic dodge... if you are willing to stick with finessable weapons but gain range attack prowess.

The thing is: in order to qualify for WM a STR build needs to invest at least 5 skill points that pure fighter would not need to allot that would otherwise probably be better served to boost CON up closer to a 500 base, a level more typical of an in-your-face non-magical melee build.  Figure around 600 bumped or more depending on the server's item enhancement level and endure pots.  Haven't tried to plot it out, but you may be able to fit exotic in there for slashing kukri or else stick with a piercing rapier since finessing costs a feat itself.  If you can't find keen edge scrolls (or have your magician partymate keen for you) it won't make any difference between scimi and rapier anyway.

With the dex build, damage will drop (except for successful sneaks) but you will have a more respectable AC and get hit much less vs. melee or range by virtue of ED, kinda takes advantage of the nerfed DevCrit you mentioned.  Maybe even get crippling strike to weaken all those STR opponents in your face?  Another option.

I'm not selling anything here, just offering something to consider outside the box and I'm sure Empyre could pull one of these out of his non-magical bag of tricks for you. ;)

P.S. Oh, and btw, as far as skill allotment goes... the most you need in UMD to succeed the check for all scrolls on every roll is a modified level of 33. My reasoning is that a million gold for a class emulation should be good enough 99% of the time and if there are some uber high-value items, then I would not stop until 40.  You could even allot fewer ranks than 33 by chugging an Eagle pot before reading scrolls.
